snippet: Belgium is losing its diamond business to lower-cost centers in India.
abstract: Belgium is losing its diamond business to lower-cost centers in India.
lead_paragraph: In Antwerp, Belgium, it’s hard to miss the posters and banners that read: “Antwerp Loves Diamonds,” John Tagliabue wrote in The New York Times. “Though this Belgian port has had a love affair with diamonds for centuries, of late it seems to be losing some of its passion.” As its losing much of the “lucrative but labor-intensive business of cutting and polishing stones” to low-wage centers in the developing world, like Mumbai, Dubai and Shanghai.

headline.main: An Industry Struggles to Keep Its Luster
